str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Demas, a helper of Paul in Rome. Probably for Demetrios; Demas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Thessalos and nike; Thessalonice, a place in Asia Minor.
Crescens, a Christian, coadjutor of Paul. Of Latin origin; growing; Cresces, a Christian.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of foreign origin; Galatia, a region of Asia.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Probably of foreign derivation; Dalmatia, a region of Europe.
